issue.title: Avoid race conditions in refreshSymbolTable
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid race conditions between the refreshing of the crash-time stack unwinder in the NDK module, and the `refreshSymbolTable` functions.

## Changelog

- `bsg_unwinder_refresh` now completely rebuilds the crash-time stack unwinder and only updates the pointer once the new unwinder is fully initialised.
- `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` localises its reference to the crash-time unwinder upon entry to keep the reference stable.
- `unwinding_crash_stack` is used to ensure that the unwinder used by `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` is not destroyed by a concurrent `bsg_unwinder_refresh`

## Testing
A new mazerunner scenario was introduced that crashes the app while repeatedly rebuilding the unwinder. This scenario will break (most of the time) if the refresh interferes with the stack unwind. Under manual testing this break happens for almost every test, but given the race-condition nature of this we can expect some fakes (but only on regression).

issue.title: Replaced "first significant stack frames" step with "any significant frames"
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.title: Avoid race conditions in refreshSymbolTable
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid race conditions between the refreshing of the crash-time stack unwinder in the NDK module, and the `refreshSymbolTable` functions.

## Changelog

- `bsg_unwinder_refresh` now completely rebuilds the crash-time stack unwinder and only updates the pointer once the new unwinder is fully initialised.
- `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` localises its reference to the crash-time unwinder upon entry to keep the reference stable.
- `unwinding_crash_stack` is used to ensure that the unwinder used by `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` is not destroyed by a concurrent `bsg_unwinder_refresh`

## Testing
A new mazerunner scenario was introduced that crashes the app while repeatedly rebuilding the unwinder. This scenario will break (most of the time) if the refresh interferes with the stack unwind. Under manual testing this break happens for almost every test, but given the race-condition nature of this we can expect some fakes (but only on regression).

issue.title: Replaced "first significant stack frames" step with "any significant frames"
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.body:
## 5.28.0 (2022-10-13)

### Enhancements

* Bugsnag now supports up to 500 breadcrumbs, with a default max of 100. Note that breadcrumbs will be trimmed
  (oldest first) if the payload exceeds 1MB.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.title: Avoid race conditions in refreshSymbolTable
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid race conditions between the refreshing of the crash-time stack unwinder in the NDK module, and the `refreshSymbolTable` functions.

## Changelog

- `bsg_unwinder_refresh` now completely rebuilds the crash-time stack unwinder and only updates the pointer once the new unwinder is fully initialised.
- `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` localises its reference to the crash-time unwinder upon entry to keep the reference stable.
- `unwinding_crash_stack` is used to ensure that the unwinder used by `bsg_unwind_crash_stack` is not destroyed by a concurrent `bsg_unwinder_refresh`

## Testing
A new mazerunner scenario was introduced that crashes the app while repeatedly rebuilding the unwinder. This scenario will break (most of the time) if the refresh interferes with the stack unwind. Under manual testing this break happens for almost every test, but given the race-condition nature of this we can expect some fakes (but only on regression).

issue.body:
## Goal
Allow end to end tests to be more tolerant of platform changes when looking at native symbolicated stack traces. Some versions of Android cause `libunwind` to include signal handler frames at the top of the stack-trace causing a strict "first significant frames" check to fail.

## Design
Modified the "first significant stack frames" step to allow the list of expected frames to appear anywhere in the symbolicated stack-trace, as long as the frames remain sequential.

## Testing
Enabled all of the tests that were failing on Android 7 / 7.1 and verified they all run again.

issue.title: Avoid thread-starvation in BackgroundTaskService
issue.body:
## Goal
Avoid possible thread starvation when submitting tasks to the `BackgroundTaskService`.

## Design
Changed the `BackgroundTaskService` to internally be able to identify its threads. When a new task is submitted it will first check to see if the task would be sent to the current thread, and if so the task is run immediately and the result is returned.

## Testing
A new unit test was added that causes thread starvation by adding a task to each queue, which then adds a task to the same queue and then blocks on both tasks to await their completion. This triggers a deadlock as the first task waits for itself to complete.

issue.title: Introduce option to attempt delivery on crash
issue.body:
## Goal
Allow a delivery attempt to be made during a crash (when configured).

## Design
When configured by `Configuration.setAttemptDeliveryOnCrash(true)` an unhandled JVM exception will be encoded to storage, and then the notifier will immediately attempt to deliver it on our existing worker. The delivery will block the crashing thread for a maximum of 3 seconds before cancelling the delivery attempt and returning.

The 3 second allowance:
- ensures that the app does not complete its crash while the notifier is attempting delivery
- should avoid triggering an ANR in most cases (the encoding and storage of the error is counted towards this deadline)

## Testing
A new end to end test scenario was added to test this functionality by throwing an unhandled exception, and expecting delivery *without* an app restart.

issue.title: Set NDK lineNumber == frameAddress - loadAddress
issue.body:
## Goal
Ensure that the NDK line numbers, frame address and load address always line-up as expected by symbolication.

## Design
Set the `frameAddress` according to the expectations in symbolication to avoid the subtle differences that appear from platform-to-platform.

## Testing
Relied on the new end-to-end tests which enforce the `lineNumber == frameAddress - loadAddress` contract of all NDK reports.
